subject: Re: [junit] Can I create a dynamic JUnit ?  (in Cactus Framework)

messageBody:
Cedric Beust wrote:

> > From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
> Donny Widjaja
>
> > When I debug my code, I saw that JUnit calls my constructor,
> > and added the object into the suite. However, when it runs
> > the test case, it try to re-create the object again by
> > calling generic constructor with no-args or one arguments.
>
> This is by design in JUnit: your test objects are reinstantiated from
> scratch before every test method, which makes it hard to maintain state
> between method invocations.

That's a little misleading and a little untrue. _If_ you run JUnit on a
class without a suite() method, or you have a suite() method that calls
TestSuite.addTestSuite(Class), then _before any method is executed_, a
fresh instance of the test class is created for each test method in the
class. However, if you have a suite() method that calls
TestSuite.addTest(Test), which Donny did, then no such "automatic"
creation _should_ happen. The fact that he's still seeing it in the
debugger probably means that something unintentionally is happening,
either in his JUnit invocation or suite() method.

David Saff
